heroInfo.eventDescription: What if the internet was yours to reinvent? Mozilla invites you to an in-person event to shape its destiny and celebrate visionary voices who champion a more ethical, responsible and inclusive web. Together, let’s reclaim the internet.

talks.name: Reclaim The Internet Exhibition
talks.content: Embark on an immersive journey to reimagine a digital space that explores the beauty of community, empowers individual expression and celebrates inclusiveness.

talks.name: Reclaim The Internet Exhibition
talks.content: Embark on an immersive journey to reimagine a digital space that explores the beauty of community, empowers individual expression and celebrates inclusiveness.

talks.name: Rise25 Award Show
talks.content: Mozilla honors 25 people from around the world who are doing groundbreaking work to  shape the future of an internet that is more open, ethical and inclusive.

talks.name: Reclaim The Internet Exhibition
talks.content: Embark on an immersive journey to reimagine a digital space that explores the beauty of community, empowers individual expression and celebrates inclusiveness.

talks.name: Foundations of the Future Web: An Evening for Developers
talks.content: The Mozilla Innovation team invites you to hear from developers pushing the boundaries of what the web can do through new, decentralized, and open protocols, projects and applications.
talks.additional:
Speakers:

  • Jeff Lindsay
  • Raphael Mimoun
  • Yoshiki Ohshima
  • Keoni Mahelona
  • Gordon Brander
  • Moderated by Imo Udom

talks.name: Reclaim The Internet Exhibition
talks.content: Embark on an immersive journey to reimagine a digital space that explores the beauty of community, empowers individual expression and celebrates inclusiveness.

talks.name: Does Privacy Have a Future?
talks.additional:
Join a discussion with German privacy experts about the current state of privacy trends both troubling and encouraging; and what consumers can do to maximize their privacy online. Featuring:

  • Anna Biselli, Editor in Chief, Netzpolitik
  • Malte Spitz, Secretary General, Gesellschaft für Freiheitsrechte
  • Ashley Boyd, SVP Global Advocacy, Mozilla

talks.name: Reclaim The Internet Exhibition
talks.content: Embark on an immersive journey to reimagine a digital space that explores the beauty of community, empowers individual expression and celebrates inclusiveness.

talks.name: CTRL: Celebrating People Who Challenge The Default
talks.content: How do you challenge the status quo in your industry? A mix of inspiring tech, culture, and fashion challengers will gather and celebrate the release of a book dedicated to them, CTRL.

eventInfo.venueDescription: A former mint transformed into an event space on the banks of the Spree river, Alte Münze now shapes common and tangible spaces for cultural and artistic diversity.

directions.title: Getting there
directions.content: Located in the middle of Berlin, Alte Münze is easily reachable by public transport. The metro lines U5 (Rotes Rathaus) and U2 (Klosterstraße) are only a short walk away. U-bahn and S-bahn Alexanderplatz also offer a wide range of transportation options only 10 minutes away from the venue.

directions.title: Accessibility
directions.content:
Alte Münze is a wheelchair accessible space.
For the public exhibition, please note that the first room installation will feature flashing lights, and the third room may potentially present sensitivity issues for individuals with epilepsy. We strongly recommend that attendees exercise discretion and take into consideration any personal sensitivities or health concerns.
